page.title: 08ROADS AND ROAD DEVELOPMENT
page.content: The major communication through the area is the Warwick-Banbury Road, the A425,linking with the A41(T) at junction south of Park Farm.Leading from this a new road,Europa Way has been cut,with the purpose of joining the{Heathcote Industrial Estate}to the main routes from Banbury,Coventry and Birmingham. The{M40}from London to Oxford is planned to be extended in the near future and could affect the area as it would link with the{Sherbourne}end of the{Warwick}by-pass.Already a section of the A41(T) from Sherbourne to the junction with the A425 has provision for dual carriageway.There are also strong interests pushing for the canalisation of the Avon from Stratford-Upon-Avon to Warwick where a link would be made with the Grand Union Canal.
